title: Transportation
description: public transport, taxis, tour transport and ride-share cars are free from use, but Drivers and passengers must wear face masks at all times — including waiting at stations.

title: Mandatory face masks
description:
Public transport, commercial passenger vehicles
Visitors to a hospital or care facility
Inside airport and flight to and from Victoria
When you are diagnosed with COVID-19 or a close contact of someone diagnosed with COVID-19 and leave your accommodation for a permitted reason
while waiting for COVID-19 test result and leaving your accommodation for a permitted reason
Have symptoms of COVID-19

title: Traffic-light permit system
description:
Victoria classifies regions of Australia as green, orange or red, based on the region's COVID-19 risk. Non-Victorian residents can't enter Victoria from a red zone.
check your current area here:
- Green: can apply for a permit and enter Victoria
- Orange: Can apply for a single-use permit and need to be tested for COVID-19 within 3 days of your arrival in Victoria and isolated until you get a negative test result. Testing location https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/where-get-tested-covid-19
- Red: Only get permit if you’re Victorian resident. Otherwise, be fined $4957 and sent back.
